title: As Woody Cook leaves The Circle, are Fatboy Slim and Zoe Ball an item?
text:
Zoe Ball (left) and Norman Cook (right) have praised son Woody Cook (centre) after he came fifth in The Circle (Picture: Eamonn McCormack/WireImage)

Fatboy Slim – aka Norman Cook – and Zoe Ball cheered son Woody on as he reached the final of Channel 4 reality show The Circle after charming his fellow contestants and the public during almost a month away from his home city of Brighton.

The 18-year-old student, who is the elder brother to Cook and Ball’s daughter, Nelly May Louise, finished fifth in the hunt for the £70,000 top prize.

Cook was a popular figure during his time on the show, helping winner Paddy Smyth celebrate his triumph in the final episode of the second series.

He had spent 22 episodes in the apartment in Salford where The Circle is filmed, communicating with the rest of the cast solely through the purpose-built social media platform the show is named after.

Are Norman Cook and Zoe Ball still married?

Cook and Ball have shown an endearingly united front while supporting their son on the show, although they ended their 17-year marriage in 2016.

The pair married in Somerset in 1999, when Cook was at the peak of his fame under his DJ alias of Fatboy Slim.

Ball was a proud mum as Woody made the grade in his GCSEs two years ago (Picture: PA Archive/PA Images)

A year earlier, Cook achieved the most commercially successful feat of his long musical career when his second album as Fatboy Slim, You’ve Come a Long Way, Baby, went to number one.

He also scored his first number one single with feelgood hit Praise You in the same year he tied the knot with Ball, who is one of the most recognisable and popular presenters in the UK.

When was Woody Cook born?

Ball – the daughter of TV favourite Johnny Ball – gave birth to Woody in December 2000.

The Blackpool-born former BBC Radio 1 breakfast host split up with Cook in 2003, but the pair reignited their relationship three months later.

They then officially parted ways again in September 2016, although a statement confirming ‘the end of our rainbow’ strongly suggested the split was amicable.

Their continuing friendship has been underlined by their unity during Woody’s time on The Circle, publicly wishing their son luck and releasing an affectionate video message supporting him.

Woody said: ‘My parents do know I’m doing the show and they are supportive. They have ­given me a lot to think about from past experiences, and advice.

‘They said that what you say on TV is out there forever and you can’t unsay it and that once you share too much you never unshare it.’

Ball congratulates fellow finalist Tim, who won the People’s Champion vote (Picture: Peter Powell/PA Wire)

In an exclusive interview with Metro.co.uk, he admitted that they had initially told him: ‘We spent the whole time trying to keep yourself under wraps and you’re just about to throw yourself out there, for a reality show?’

Speaking about their video message, he gleefully added: ‘When they sent me that video that went “We were..wr…wr…wrooong!” I was like “Yes! You were wrong, weren’t you?”

‘Just hearing that was one of the first times I’d ever heard that in my life. I was so “I told you guys!” and now I’m really happy.’
